title: what font is this?
content:
what font is the "stella" wordmark at the bottom left of the page?  
any ideas? any help, much appreciated. thanks in advance.  
 [http://www.liveatstella.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.liveatstella.com/ "http://www.liveatstella.com")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-05-14 at 7.50.52 AM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-05-14%20at%207.50.52%20AM.png) | 8.05 KB |
author: rockstardesigner

comments.content:
Close to [Reversion](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ywft/reversion/?refby=bowfin) by You Work For Them.  
There might be a Dafont freebie like this too, since square techno stuff is pretty popular (and easy to draw).

- Mike Yanega

To me, no font is needed to do such a lettering as it is only made with strokes. You could also easily do the same starting from any pixel/bitmap font of your choice. If you still need something that could quickly do the job, may be having a look to some sections at DaFont would worth a shot: **[Bitmap \> Pixel, Bitmap](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/bitmap.php)** and [Techno \> Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=301).  
Some in the same vein: [AnaScript](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/anascript.font) ("closing" letters), [SF Square Head Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/sf-square-head.font), [MGS2-Menu](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.ffonts.net/MGS2-Menu.font), [Low Gun Screen Expanded](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.ffonts.net/Low-Gun-Screen-Expanded.font), [Reversion](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/font/T0017/ywft-reversion), [04b-31](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/04b-31.font), [Abstract](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.dafont.com/abstract.font), [Fonts For Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.fontsforflash.com/), [miniml](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055501/http:/www.miniml.com/fonts/index.html)
thanks for all the info. appreciate the help. yes, this could be drawn, but its for a pitch book that I need to finish in a week, so no time to draw word marks. thanks again.
